abstracts.cdata!:
The Tri-provincial Highway Project will
            finance construction of a new right-of-way or improvement of
            the major highways in Inner Mongolia, Gansu, and Ningxia.
            This environmental impact assessment report consists of
            three parts: a) the section from Baotou to Dongsheng, and
            the section from Baiyinchagan to Fengzheng of Inner
            Mongolia; b) Liugouhe-Zhonghe and Xiujiamo-Gulang Section of
            Gansu; and c) Guyaozi-Wangquanliang Highway of Ningxia.
            Households to be removed will be compensated in accordance
            with the resettlement plan.  Noise will be mitigated by
            equipping high-noise construction machinery with sound-proof
            features and by monitoring noise of vehicles.  Dust during
            construction will be reduced by spraying water.  To prevent
            soil erosion and ensure stable subgrades, retaining walls,
            stone square network slopes, and reliable drainage work will
            be installed.  To mitigate the impact on vegetation,
            planting will be done throughout the project.  Arable land
            will be restored and reclaimed.  Waste water produced from
            the service centers will be treated and waste materials will
            be carried to waste stations for disposal.
